qas.question: In what city are the headquarters of the MoD?
Who designed the headquarters of the MoD?
Who designed the statues that are on either side of the northern entrance to the MoD headquarters?
What is the headquarters of the MoD called?
What did Vincent Harris originally build in 2004?
When was the Gurkha Monument refurbished?
What group refurbished the Gurkha Monument in 2004?
When was Horse Guards Avenue unveiled by Queen Elizabeth II?

plausible_answers.text: two monumental statues, Earth and Water

qas.question: What did Vincent Harris create near the northern entrance of the MoD Headquarters?

context: <b5_0>The headquarters of the MoD<b5_0/> are in <a0_0>Whitehall<a0_0/> and are now known as <a3_0>Main Building<a3_0/>. This structure is neoclassical in style and was originally built between 1938 and 1959 to designs by <a1_0>Vincent Harris<a1_0/> to house the Air Ministry and the Board of Trade. The northern entrance in Horse Guards Avenue is flanked by <b9_0>two monumental statues, Earth and Water<b9_0/>, by <a2_0>Charles Wheeler<a2_0/>. Opposite stands the Gurkha Monument, sculpted by <a4_0>Philip Jackson<a4_0/> and unveiled in <b8_0>1997<b8_0/> by Queen Elizabeth II. Within it is the Victoria Cross and George Cross Memorial, and nearby are memorials to the Fleet Air Arm and RAF (to its east, facing the riverside). A major refurbishment of the building was completed under a PFI contract by <b7_0>Skanska<b7_0/> <b6_0>in 2004<b6_0/>.
